page.title: 04Employment in Horsmonden
page.content: The shops in Horsmonden employ l9 people most of them local. Boddingtons, the Plastics factory, employs ll5 and Louis Reece, a fruit distribution depot, employs l02. The Apple Growers Association employs 33 and Heath Engineering 43 but many of these are not Horsmonden villagers. Many people commute to London going by road to Paddock Wood and then by fast train, a journey of 50 minutes. Some go by car or bus to Tunbridge Wells, Tonbridge or Maidstone. The traditional occupation of the area is farming particularly fruit and hops. Orchards of cherries and apples abounded in the area but many have now been replaced by cereals. The favourite Kentish apples are Cox's Orange Pippins and Bramleys. Picked from September onwards these are famous throughout the land.
